biography.bio: Ikkô Furuya was born on January 2, 1944 in Tokyo, Japan as Kazuyuki Furuya. He is an actor, known for Yokomizo Seishi shirîzu (1977), Kin'yôbi no tsumatachi e (1983) and Kindaichi Kosuke no boken (1979).
biography.name: Ikkô Furuya

biography.bio: Kunie Tanaka was born on November 23, 1932 in Gifu, Japan. He is an actor, known for Battles Without Honor and Humanity (1973), Sanjuro (1962) and La servante et le samouraï (2004).
biography.name: Kunie Tanaka

biography.bio: Miyoko Akaza was born on February 10, 1944 in Aichi, Japan. She is an actress, known for Lady Snowblood (1973), Amours dans la neige (1968) and Haruka, nosutarujii (1993).
biography.name: Miyoko Akaza

biography.bio: Chiyonosuke Azuma was born on August 19, 1926 in Tokyo, Japan as Takayuki Wakawada. He was an actor, known for Ninjutsu suikoden inazuma kotengu (1958), Bijo to kairyu (1955) and Jipangu (1990). He died on November 9, 2000 in Shinjuku, Tokyo.
biography.name: Chiyonosuke Azuma

biography.bio: Fumi Dan was born on June 5, 1954 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Après la pluie (1999), House (1977) and Long Shadows (1994).
biography.name: Fumi Dan

biography.bio: Jirô Daruma is an actor, known for Himitsu Sentai Gorenger (1975), Kindaichi Kosuke no boken (1979) and Go Ranger: The Red Death March (1976).
biography.name: Jirô Daruma

biography.bio: Toshio Egi was born on June 4, 1952 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor and producer, known for High and Low (1963), The Space Giants (1966) and Isoge! Wakamono: Tomorrow Never Waits (1974).
biography.name: Toshio Egi

biography.bio: Jun Harada is an actor, known for Kindaichi Kosuke no boken (1979) and Hadashi no Gen part 3: Hiroshima no tatakai (1980).
biography.name: Jun Harada

biography.bio: Shinsaku Himeda was born on November 19, 1916 in Hyogo, Japan. He was a cinematographer and actor, known for Vengeance Is Mine (1979), Hachi-ko (1987) and La Femme insecte (1963). He died on July 29, 1997.
biography.name: Shinsaku Himeda

biography.bio: Megumi Ishii was born as Yoko Ishii. She is an actress, known for Danna sama wa 18 sai (1982), Yasha-ga-ike (1979) and Minatomachi ninjô nâsu 3 (2008).
biography.name: Megumi Ishii

biography.bio: Hajime Izu was born on July 6, 1918 in Japan. He was an actor and writer, known for Stray Dog (1949), Mobile Sheriff Jiban (1989) and Desertion at Dawn (1950). He died in 2005.
biography.name: Hajime Izu

biography.bio: When his father dies in 1975, Haruki was appointed president of the Kadokawa Shoten and he announced a new and ambitious plan for his company: created a new branch dedicated to produce films and impel international cinematographic adaptations of the best-seller novels and comics of the publishing branch. "The Inugami Family" was the first film produced by Kadokawa. The success of the planning encouraged Kadokawa to direct some movies himself. His debut as director was "Dirty Hero" (1982), followed by "Love Story" (1984). In 1990 he directed his most acclaimed film, "Heaven and Earth". Unfortunately his popularity declined after he was arrested for drug possession.
biography.name: Haruki Kadokawa

biography.bio: Kirin Kiki was born on January 15, 1943 in Tokyo, Japan as Keiko Uchida. She is an actress, known for Sweet Bean (2015), Returner (2002) and Still Walking (2008). She is married to Yûya Uchida. They have one child. She was previously married to Shin Kishida.
biography.name: Kirin Kiki

biography.bio: Takayasu Kinoshita is an actor, known for Kindaichi Kosuke no boken (1979), Okasare shigan (1982) and Namadori tocho video (1982).
biography.name: Takayasu Kinoshita

biography.bio: A highly distinctive character actor, discovered by a director with a flair for finding such faces--Kihachi Okamoto, who cast Kishida in his film Kiru (1968)--Kishida spent most of his acting career being typecast according to his looks. A consequence of this typecasting was his most famous role in Japan, that of the "Japanese Dracula" played in two Toho movies produced by Fumio Tanaka and directed by Michio Yamamoto. An avid fan of fantasy and science fiction, Shin Kishida also wrote a number of scenarios for that genre. Cast by veteran director Ishiro Honda, he also co-starred as the handicapped mechanic in Kaetekita Urutoraman (1971). Other highly visible roles outside Japan included that of one of the three evil brothers in Shogun Assassin (1981) and that of the mysterious Interpol agent in Gojira tai Mekagojira (1974). Much in demand as both a writer and an actor, Kishida succumbed to lung cancer three days after Christmas, 1982.
biography.name: Shin Kishida
